african_election_narratives.description: Claims that Western nations manipulate elections.
Accusations of widespread rigging by incumbents.
african_election_narratives.purpose_effect: Undermine confidence in the electoral process.

african_election_narratives.description: Suggests that biometric systems or voting tech are compromised.
african_election_narratives.purpose_effect: Undermine trust in digitised election systems.

african_election_narratives.description: Frame outsider candidates as incorruptible, saviour figures.
african_election_narratives.purpose_effect: Fuel cult-like devotion; position candidate as anti-establishment messiah.

african_election_narratives.description: Candidates are presented as "chosen by God" or predicted to win by religious figures.
african_election_narratives.purpose_effect: Exploit religious beliefs for legitimacy or support.

african_election_narratives.description: Amplifies ethnic or religious divisions for political gain.
african_election_narratives.purpose_effect: Incite violence, suppress votes, polarise the electorate.

african_election_narratives.description: Claims that the system is rigged against young voters.
tactics_used: Viral posts about PVC collection issues
african_election_narratives.purpose_effect: Suppress youth voter turnout, create apathy.

african_election_narratives.description: Spreads rumours of an impending military coup or intervention.
Fabricates polling data or clones legitimate news sites to spread disinformation.
tactics_used: Professional-looking graphics with fake poll results
african_election_narratives.purpose_effect: Manipulate public opinion, create a bandwagon effect.
